intro: Astragalus munzurensis, commonly known as the Munzur astragalus, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
